full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 102 of 236 1006 LC3Cmax3 Alessi - cross 1 Q. And so they would come to you and say, I did five massages last week, so I need $500; right? 2 A. Yes, sir. 3 Q. And then you would write a check for $500? 4 A. Exactly. 5 Q. And that was the process that you went through through 2002 when you worked for Mr. Epstein; is that right? 6 A. Yes, sir. 7 Q. And to your knowledge, you never observed -- first of all, no one forced anyone to come to the house; correct? 8 A. No, they were not forced to come to the house. 9 Q. People came to the house because they wanted to come to the house to give a massage; right? 10 MS. COMEY: Objection. 11 THE COURT: Sustained. 12 Q. No one complained to you about having to come to the house; correct? 13 A. No, sir. 14 Q. And no one came into the house, that you observed, looked afraid or hurt or screaming or anything that would show you that they were in any kind of distress; correct? 15 A. No, sir, never. 16 Q. And during the entire time you were there, people would come, they would give their massage, and then they would get paid and leave, and no one complained to you about anything; 17 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00012616
